intro: Koeleria hirta, commonly known as the hairy koeleria, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is native to arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cold climates. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale blue or white flowers. Koeleria hirta is often found in open habitats such as tundra, meadows, and rocky slopes.
